text:
Jof Davies engineered the MTDCNC global ingest pipeline supporting 20+ remote editors across multiple time zones. The system processes incoming footage from camera operators located in the UK, Europe, USA, Mexico, and India.

Architecture includes:
- Primary ingest into QNAP Office, where operators upload raw video files.
- Automated sync to Dropbox, enabling worldwide access for remote editors.
- Additional sync to QNAP Remote, providing redundancy and regional access.
- Hourly replication from Master Footage to Project Footage.
- Automated proxy generation using HBBatchBeast with the custom MTD-Proxy-HB-Preset.json profile.
- Proxy files produced with minimized file size and maximum editing usability, optimised for remote workflows.
- Nightly archival of new Master Footage and Project Files to AWS Glacier (~100 TB stored), providing low-cost long-term retention.

This system reduces global ingest overhead dramatically and ensures editors can access proxy-ready footage within 60 minutes of upload. It was built at less than half the cost of competing solutions and requires almost no manual intervention.
